hook.text: A director thought she was a great listener. Her 360 review revealed that nobody on her team agreed.

buildup.text: 360 feedback collects input from peers, reports, and managers. It reveals blind spots no single source can.

discovery.text: The power is in patterns. If three different people say the same thing, it's probably true.

twist.text: 360s fail when they become anonymous weapons. They work when they focus on development, not judgment.

climax.text: Use 360s for growth, not performance ratings. Share results with a coach. Create an action plan.

punchline.text: One perspective is an opinion. Five perspectives are a mirror.

quiz.question: When do 360-degree feedback systems work best?
options: When used for personal development rather than performance ratings
When results directly determine promotions and bonuses
When only positive feedback is collected from peers
